(See the "Lists Consulted" section for full details.)  The composers run from Jacopo Peri, who wrote the first ever opera in late 16th century Italy, to John Adams, one of the leading figures in the contemporary operatic world.  The brief accompanying notes offer an explanation as to why each composer has been considered major.  Also included is a section about major women opera composers, compiled from the same lists. steps.observation: Giuseppe Fortunino Francesco Verdi (] ; 9 or 10 October 1813 – 27 January 1901) was an Italian opera composer.

steps.thought: I've confirmed that Giuseppe Verdi is an Opera composer. Now, I need to find out about Ambroise Thomas. I'll retrieve his document to confirm his profession.
steps.observation: Charles Louis Ambroise Thomas (5 August 1811 – 12 February 1896) was a French composer, best known for his operas "Mignon" (1866) and "Hamlet" (1868, after Shakespeare) and as Director of the Conservatoire de Paris from 1871 till his death.

steps.thought: I've confirmed that Ambroise Thomas is also an Opera composer. Now that I have information about both composers, I can answer the question.

action_input.answer: Yes, both Giuseppe Verdi and Ambroise Thomas are Opera composers.

steps.observation: Task completed. Final answer: Yes, both Giuseppe Verdi and Ambroise Thomas are Opera composers.

runs.final_answer: Yes, both Giuseppe Verdi and Ambroise Thomas are Opera composers.
